attributes.action: Review ECV guidlines to lower the risk of our daughters' death being repeated
attributes.additional_details: We request that the House of Commons urges the Department of Health to review the current policies into the monitoring of foetal heartrate before and after ECV; to increase the time that babies are monitored after ECV; to review the data on risks of ECV, including compression risks; to review statistics held on unsuccessful ECVs and the reasons for them and statistics held on injuries and fatalities caused by ECV; and to change the information on ECV that is given to pregnant women who are offered the ECV procedure including all risks and statistics.
attributes.background:
ECV is a procedure carried out to turn a breech baby to a 'head down' position.
Please sign for vital changes to be be made, awareness to be heard and for the protection of the lives of babies whose lives are turned upside down.
To read Rebecca's story:
www.justiceforrebeccaflorence.wordpress.com
